content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: TSVAL
      operator: non_empty
    - name: TSVAL
      operator: is_not_contained_by_case_insensitive
      value:
        - NI
        - INV
        - DER
        - OTH
        - NINF
        - PINF
        - UNC
        - MSK
        - NA
        - UNK
        - ASKU
        - NAV
        - NASK
        - NAVU
        - NAV
        - QS
        - TRC
        - NP
    - name: TSVALNF
      operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000041
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: When TSVAL is not populated with values or synonyms of values in the
  ISO 21090 null flavor codelist (or other terms that can be represented as null flavors),
  unless the term is included in published terminology, TSVALNF should be null.
Outcome:
  Message: TSVALNF is populated when TSVAL is populated with a value that is not in
    the ISO 21090 null flavor codelist.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0649
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Some codelists used for TSVAL include terms which
                  are also null flavors. For example, the Pharmaceutical Dosage Form
                  codelist includes the values 'UNKNOWN' and 'NOT APPLICABLE. In such
                  cases, TSVAL should have the term from the codelist and TSVALNF
                  should be null.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 11
                Section: 7.4.2
              - Cited Guidance: While it would be possible to allow a value such as
                  NONE or UNBOUNDED to be entered in TSVAL,  validation programs would
                  then have to recognize this special term as an exception to the
                  expected data format. Therefore, it was decided that a separate
                  null flavor variable that uses the ISO 21090 null flavor terminology
                  would be a better solution.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Section: 7.4.2.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - TRIAL DESIGN
  Domains:
    Include:
      - TS

json.Description: When TSVAL is not populated with values or synonyms of values in the ISO 21090 null flavor codelist (or other terms that can be represented as null flavors), unless the term is included in published terminology, TSVALNF should be null.

Outcome.Message: TSVALNF is populated when TSVAL is populated with a value that is not in the ISO 21090 null flavor codelist.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Some codelists used for TSVAL include terms which are also null flavors. For example, the Pharmaceutical Dosage Form codelist includes the values 'UNKNOWN' and 'NOT APPLICABLE. In such cases, TSVAL should have the term from the codelist and TSVALNF should be null.

While it would be possible to allow a value such as NONE or UNBOUNDED to be entered in TSVAL,  validation programs would then have to recognize this special term as an exception to the expected data format. Therefore, it was decided that a separate null flavor variable that uses the ISO 21090 null flavor terminology would be a better solution.
